subject: Management
title: Warren Buffett's Two-List Method
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Warren Buffett's Two-List Method.

hook.text: Buffett told his pilot to write 25 career goals. Then he circled the top 5.

buildup.text: The pilot assumed the other 20 were secondary priorities to work on between the big five.

discovery.text: Buffett said: no. The other 20 are your avoid-at-all-costs list. They're the most dangerous distractions.

twist.text: Goals 6-20 feel productive. That's what makes them deadly. They steal time from what matters most.

climax.text: Pick your top five. Say no to everything else until those five are done.

punchline.text: The enemy of great isn't bad. It's good enough to distract you.

quiz.question: What is the key insight of Buffett's two-list method?
options: Goals outside your top five are dangerous distractions, not secondary priorities
You should work on all 25 goals simultaneously
The bottom 20 goals should be delegated to your team
